Description: Lower body sherd and conical foot of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: bottom of bowl glazed streaky black with trace of added white; exterior: bowl reserved; foot glazed streaky black; underside: fugitive slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1160) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 40 (Other Accession Number)
